name: Gran Duca di York

reviews.text: This is a clean, comfortable and reasonably priced hotel in a good location.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, good value (for Milan)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are reasonable in size, impecably clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Good hotel, location is excellent!
Not impressed
reviews.text: Location is excellent, very central close to Cathedral, but in a back street so nice and quiet.
Staff were very helpful, and the cost was reasonable for Milan.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in an excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Great location and lovely hotel

likes.disliked: — Could have had a better view from the window

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was surprised this wasn't ranked higher. The service was five star. They let us check in at 10am...we really needed a shower after the evening flight. I can't remember the last time a Euro hotel let me check in that far in advance. The guys at the desk were very helpful, even offered to switch our rooms so we could get in earlier. One night (pretty late) we asked for another blanket when we got back to the hotel. It seemed like there was a little confusion about what we were asking for but the blanket showed up at our door litteral seconds after we shut it. The bathroom was very spacious and clean. The room was modern, totally quiet, had direct tv, and a little view over the street. My only complaint was the breakfast, it was bad. Walk a couple blocks and get something at a cafe. They did have bottles of water, which I took every morning. The location is also great. Very quite street just a couple blocks from the Doumo (if you cut through the merchants square it's a 2 minute walk). All in all, it was a nice place. I would definately recommend.
reviews.title: A+

reviews.text: Great great location - steps away from the Duomo. Service was just ok. Breakfast was ok - but again service wasn't really around. Again key was location Accommodations were new & clean but the elevators were tiny - to the point of being slightly claustrophobic.
reviews.title: Great Location, rooms and elevators small

likes.disliked: — Rooms kind of small - service was spotty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are in Milan - don't miss the Last Supper - you have to book ahead so definitely do so! Also it really is the city of shopping. Great gelateria close to Santa Maria Delle Grazie - think it was called Chocolate and it had more than 5 different flavours of just chocolate gelato.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

likes.liked: — Superb location, helpful desk staff, secure parking.

reviews.text: We stayed for two nights during the weekend of the Italian Grand Prix at Monza. The weather was terrible but we've no complaints about the hotel! Our initial booking was handled very efficiently and hotel staff were really helpful in responding to all queries about the hotel location, etc. On arrival we parked directly outside and our car was whisked away to secure garage parking (pre booked with hotel). Fortunately the garage was very close as my partner realised he'd left something important in the boot! One word of advice if you are driving to the hotel - take great care following the directions! We took one wrong turn and drove for about ten minutes in a restricted area before ending up at a pedestrian only area - there are a lot of one way systems in Milan! In desperation I asked a gentleman for directions (fortunately he spoke excellent English) and he kindly suggested that we follow him. It took at least ten minutes turning up and down tiny back streets and he took us directly to the door of the hotel. As the hotel is located on a one way street he had to drive on even before we had a chance to say thank you. We could never have navigated that route ourselves and are eternally grateful to that extremely kind gent. (And we were told to expect rudeness in Milan!) Our room was spotlessly clean, quiet (overlooking the street) and if you stretched your neck out the window had a view of the Madonna on top of the Cathedral - perfect! The guys on reception were brilliant throughout our stay giving us directions, lending us an umbrella and recommended an absolutely amazing restaurant for dinner where we had the best meal of our entire Italian holiday. Breakfast was excellent too with lots to choose from. So thank you Gran Duca di York - we will happily return and would recommend without hesitation. PS Don't miss out on the roof of the Cathedral - amazing.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!!!

reviews.text: This is a wonderful hotel in a great location. The hotel and rooms are extremely clean, the staff is very helpful and polite. I highly recommend staying here and will definitely stay here in the future.
reviews.title: A little disappointed.........

reviews.text: Milan Hotels are very expensive but not this one.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Staff, Great Price

reviews.text: The staff are very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was delicious.
reviews.title: Great find near duomo and la scala

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff were very helpful, giving directions booking diner at a nearby reastaurant and always smiling
reviews.title: Excellent location. Clean rooms. Fair price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Great location and spotlessly clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was nice and very quiet.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Milan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: About two minutes from the Duomo and tram and metro stops but we were slightly disappointed with the room. It wasn't a problem, just not up to standard of a modern four-star hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, average everything else.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel last week for 3 nights. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning to visit Milan
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prior to our arrival I had e-mailed the hotel to confirm everything was in order with the booking (not made directly with hotel) and received an e-mail back the same day confirming same.
reviews.title: Good value hotel, good breakfast
Stay Here
reviews.text: Every member of staff we came across were helpful and happy to phone us taxis, help us with directions etc. I would not say the reception staff were overly friendly but they did help out when asked.

We had one of the special rooms with its own terrace. Was a lovely large room with plenty of storage space. The terrace was a nice touch but unfortunately we couldn't really enjoy it due to the weather. The rooms was immaculately clean with a super clean bathroom (not the garish yellow style on one of the photos!). There was a free soft-drinks mini-bar in the room which was a nice touch. The only thing the room lacked was a small security safe.
reviews.title: Clean, great locaiton, but staff????

likes.disliked: — Staff was not friendly or helpful for the most part

aka: Gran Duca Di York Hotel Milan
description: The Hotel Gran Duca di York is a little charming hotel in Milan.An establishment set in an 19th century historic palace .It is located in a very quiet street just few steps from the city center.The Atmosphere is very relaxing and the lobby is decorated with a collection of authentic frescoes.33 guest rooms completely renovated with free Wi.Fi.connection and free water and soft drinks in the room minibar.The daily rates always include buffet breakfast.
